meanings.definition: Five times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: The family was excited to receive a quintuples amount of candy on Halloween.
meanings.sent2: The quintuples amount of balloons made the party decorations look extra festive.
meanings.sent3: The quintuples servings of ice cream were a delightful surprise at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as contagious as a quintuples amount of joy spreading through the room.
meanings.sent5: The quintuples rainbow in the sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To increase or be increased five times.
meanings.sent1: She hoped her investment would quintuples in value over the next few years.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden always quintuples in beauty after a good rain.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient seemed to quintuples the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: His excitement quintuples every time he sees his favorite band perform live.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation quintuples as the countdown to the event begins.

meanings.definition: A set of five similar things.
meanings.sent1: The quintuples of kittens played together in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: She collected a quintuples of colorful seashells during her beach vacation.
meanings.sent3: The quintuples of books on the shelf made it hard to choose just one to read.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together like a well-oiled quintuples, each member contributing equally.
meanings.sent5: The quintuples of trees in the park provided a beautiful backdrop for the picnic.
